title: Five journalists killed as Israel steps up bombardment across Gaza
message:
Their children were also killed during the strike, according to Al Jazeera’s team on the ground.
Before the latest deadly attacks, Israel’s war on Gaza was already considered the deadliest conflict for journalists and media workers in the world.
The New York-based Committee to Protect Journalists, which has a separate database on Palestinian journalists killed in Gaza, put the number of media workers killed as of July 5 at 108 since the war began, also making it the deadliest period since the group began gathering data in 1992.
Al Jazeera journalist, Hamza Dahdouh, the eldest son of Al Jazeera’s Gaza bureau chief, Wael Dahdouh, was among those killed by an Israeli missile strike in Khan Younis, southern Gaza, in January.
An earlier Israeli attack had wounded Wael and killed his cameraperson Samer Abudaqa during a reporting assignment in southern Gaza in December.

He died on Friday as Israeli forces conducted airstrikes on the Gaza Strip, and his death comes a day before the third anniversary of a devastating Israeli assault on the coastal enclave.

title: Ukraine Downs 24 of 27 Russian Attack Drones , Sumy Region Energy Infrastructure Hit
message:
Ukrainian air defense downed most of the strike drones that Russia launched in overnight attacks July 5-6 – however, in the Sumy region, the Russians hit “energy infrastructure,” cutting off power to several areas, Ukrainian officials said.
The consequences of an enemy attack are being clarified,” the Sumy Military Administration reported on Telegram Saturday morning.
The Air Force reported that it shot down 24 of 27 of the Iranian-made, Russian-launched, Shahed kamikaze drones over the Dnipropetrovsk, Poltava, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson, Kharkiv, Donetsk, Sumy, Chernihiv, Vinnytsia, Kyiv, Kirovohrad, and Mykolaiv regions.
The Shahed-131/136 drones were launched from Russian-occupied Crimea, in Ukraine and from the Kursk region, in Russia, Ukrainian Air Force Commander Mykola Oleshchuk stated.

title: Israeli strikes kill 16 at school housing displaced Gazans , health officials say
message:
(You can now subscribe to our(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channelCAIRO/GAZA: At least 16 people were killed in an Israeli strike on a school sheltering displaced Palestinian families in Al-Nuseirat in central Gaza on Saturday, the territory's health ministry and the official Palestinian news agency said.The Israeli military said it was looking into the report.The health ministry said the attack on the school killed at least 16 people and wounded more than 50.
Mahmoud Basal , spokesman of the Gaza Civil Emergency Service, said the number of dead could rise because many of the wounded were in critical condition.The attack on the school meant no place in the enclave was safe for families who leave their houses to seek shelters, he said in a statement.Al-Nuseirat, one of Gaza Strip's eight historic refugee camps, was the site of stepped-up Israeli bombardment on Saturday.
An air strike earlier on a house in the camp killed at least 10 people and wounded many others, according to medics.In its daily update of people killed in the nearly nine-month-old war, the Gaza health ministry said Israeli military strikes across the enclave killed at least 29 Palestinians in the past 24 hours and wounded 100 others.Among those killed in separate air strikes were five local journalists, raising the toll of journalists killed since Oct. 7 to 158, according to the Hamas-led Gaza government media office.Gaza health authorities say more than 38,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel's offensive.
Israel launched its operation, aimed at eliminating the militant Islamist group Hamas, in response to a Hamas-led assault on Israel on Oct. 7 in which 1,200 people were killed and over 250 taken hostage, according to Israeli tallies.Israeli forces, which have deepened their incursions into Rafah, in the south of the enclave near the border with Egypt, killed four Palestinian policemen and wounded eight others, in an air strike on their vehicle on Saturday, health officials said.A statement issued by the Hamas-run interior ministry said the four included Fares Abdel-Al, the head of the police force in western Rafah neighbourhood of Tel Al-Sultan.The Israeli military said forces continued "intelligence-base operations" in Rafah, destroyed several underground structures, seized weapons and equipment, and killed several Palestinian gunmen.Israel has said its operations in Rafah aim to eradicate the last Hamas armed wing battalions.The Israeli military said it eliminated a Hamas rocket cell in Deir Al-Balah in central Gaza that operated from inside a humanitarian-designated area.
It said it carried out a precise strike after taking measures to ensure civilians were unharmed.Hamas denies Israeli accusations that it uses civilian properties and facilities for military purposes.The armed wings of Hamas and the Islamic Jihad said fighters attacked Israeli forces in several areas of Gaza with anti-tank rockets and mortar bombs.
event_breakdown: At least 16 people killed in an Israeli strike on a school in Gaza; 29 Palestinians killed in Israeli strikes in Gaza; Four Palestinian policemen killed by Israeli forces; Hamas rocket cell eliminated in Deir Al-Balah in central Gaza.

title: Slovakia PM says would have joined Orban on Moscow visit AFP - World
message:
Slovakian Prime Minister Robert Fico, who survived an assassination attempt, said he would have joined his Hungarian counterpart, Viktor Orban, on his trip to Russia if his health allowed, AFP reported.
Orban traveled to Moscow for talks with Russian leader Vladimir Putin on July 5.
The visit came three days after the Hungarian premier made a trip to Kiev.
An armed attack on Fico took place in the western Slovakian town of Handlova in mid-May.
The attacker, Juraj Cintula, 71, has been charged with a politically-motivated assassination attempt.

title: Water gun fight behind SC school leads to real fight , then real shooting . 3 arrested .
message:
The Richland County Sheriff’s Department arrested three people in connection to a shooting behind a Midlands elementary school last month.
Deputies went to a local hospital at 6 p.m. on June 21 in response to a reported gunshot victim.
According to the sheriff’s department, the victim and others were playing with water guns when a fight broke out between the victim and two teens.
The sheriff’s department said 21-year-old Kiante Siller then got a gun from the trunk of a car and shot the victim.
The sheriff’s department did not release their names.

message:

The sources added that occupation forces executed the two brothers, Humam Asaad Ahmad Hashash, 23, and Harith Asaad Ahmad Hashash, 19, after bombing a home belonging to the citizen, Asaad Hashash.
Armed Palestinian resistance fighters exchanged fire with the attacking army in the vicinity of the bombing.
The Arab 48 news website reported that the army and the Shin Bet released a joint statement revealing that the army assassinated 7 people in Jenin, including a so-called “cell” that recently killed an Israeli soldier with an explosive device in Jenin.
On Friday evening, thousands of Palestinians gathered in front of the Jenin Governmental Hospital to mourn the loss of six out of the seven slain during the Israeli attack.

title: 8 arrested after gruesome murder of Indian politician
message:
Eight people were arrested in India on Saturday for the murder of a politician who championed the rights of lower-caste Indians, police said.
Six men travelling on motorbikes attacked Armstrong while he was "chatting with friends and supporters" near his home in the Tamil Nadu state capital, the Indian Express newspaper reported.
Several of Armstrong's supporters took to the streets later in the evening to protest his assassination and demand justice.
Mayawati, the national head of Armstrong's BSP, who uses one name, said the attack was "highly deplorable and condemnable".
"Armstrong's assassination is shocking and deeply saddening," he said.

title: Fico praises Orban in first public appearance since assassination attempt
message:
Fico praises Orban in first public appearance since assassination attemptSlovak Prime Minister Robert Fico on July 5 made his first public appearance since being seriously injured in an assassination attempt in May.
Fico, 59, was shot in an assassination attempt as he walked out of a government meeting in the town of Handlova on May 15.
The attack left the prime minister in serious condition, and he has since undergone two surgeries.
During his speech, Fico criticized what he referred to as liberal and progressive political ideologies and expressed praise for Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban.
Cintula reportedly told authorities that shot Fico because he disagreed with "certain policies" of the current government.

title: F1 team McLaren help military chiefs build 4 , 000mph hypersonic missile
message:
Formula One racing team McLaren has signed a contract with the Ministry of Defence to give ex-military personnel the chance to work for the legendary company.
Just days before the British Grand Prix at Silverstone, McLaren Racing and McLaren Automotive have signed the Armed Forces Covenant.
This is to help those who serve in or have served in the Armed Forces and their families to be treated fairly and to have opportunities for work.
The racing company, based in Surrey, already qualifies as an Armed Forces Friendly company by employing former military personnel and serving reservists – collectively known as the McLaren Military Network.
Piers Thynne, Chief Operating Officer of McLaren Racing, said: 'We want to set the standard for high performance in sport, and that starts with our people.

title: Mardan blast claims three lives
message:
At least three people were killed and seven others injured on Friday in a bomb blast near Jalala bridge in the Takht Bhai tehsil of Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa’s Mardan district.
District Police Officer Zahoor Babar Afridi said a remote-controlled device exploded immediately after a police vehicle passed over the bridge.
Confirming the casualties, the official explained that the people who died in the blast were travelling in a rickshaw, which was damaged along with the police vehicle.
The injured civilians were admitted to Tehsil Headquarters Hospital Takhtbhai while the policemen hurt in the blast were rushed to Mardan Medical Complex.
In a separate statement, K-P Governor Faisal Karim Kundi also condemned the blast and expressed his sympathies with the victims’ families.
event_breakdown: At least three people were killed and seven others injured in Mardan, Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa, on Friday after a bomb blast near Jalala bridge in the Takht Bhai tehsil. Two policemen and five civilians were killed when a remote-controlled device exploded shortly after a police vehicle passed over the bridge. The injured civilians were admitted to Tehsil Headquarters Hospital Takhtbhai, while the policemen hurt in the blast were rushed to Mardan Medical Complex.

title: DNA found on weapon results in murder conviction
message:
Forensic analysis of a kitchen knife found close to a murder scene has led to the conviction of a teenager for a fatal stabbing.
On Friday, 5 July, Saeed Ibrahim, 19 (25.11.04), of Algar Close Stanmore, was found guilty at Inner London Crown Court of the murder of Anis Omar Zen after tests revealed traces of both their DNA on the weapon.
A second witness saw the suspect discard items in a bush.
Three days after the murder, Ibrahim attended a north London police station where he was arrested before being interviewed.
The jury saw through this defence and convicted Ibrahim of murder.

title: Hamas clears the way for a possible cease - fire after dropping key demand – NBC Bay Area
message:
Hamas has given initial approval for a U.S.-backed proposal for a phased cease-fire deal in Gaza, dropping a key demand that Israel give an up-front commitment for a complete end to the war, a Hamas and an Egyptian official said Saturday.
Hamas still wants “written guarantees” from mediators that Israel will continue to negotiate a permanent cease-fire deal once the first phase goes into effect, the officials said.
Months of on-again off-again cease-fire talks have stumbled over Hamas’ demand that any deal include a complete end to the war.
Israeli officials have said they are worried Hamas will draw out the talks and the initial cease-fire indefinitely, without releasing all the hostages.

message:

title: HBPD : 2 People Killed , 3 Hurt in Huntington Beach Attack ; Man in Custody
message:
A stabbing attack in Huntington Beach left two people dead, and three other people injured, and a man was in custody Friday on suspicion of murder and attempted murder.
The attack was reported about 11:15 p.m. Thursday near 16th Street and Pecan Avenue, according to the Huntington Beach Police Department.
Logan Kelley, 26, of Huntington Beach, was arrested and booked on suspicion of murder and attempted murder, Jennifer Carey of the city of Huntington Beach told City News Service on Friday.
“HBPD has no reason to believe there is any further public safety threat related to this incident,” police said.
“The investigation into this incident is ongoing and no additional details will be released at this time.”

title: Slovakian PM makes first public appearance since assassination attempt
message:
Slovakia’s populist Prime Minister Robert Fico made his first public appearance on Friday since he was seriously wounded in an assassination attempt, attacking his liberal political opponents and praising his Hungarian counterpart, AP reported.
Fico gave a speech on a stage at an evening gathering to mark the 1,161 anniversary of Saints Cyril and Methodius’s arrival, a national holiday in his country.
People gave him a standing ovation when he arrived at the Devin Castle in the capital.
Fico ended his country’s military aid for Ukraine after his coalition government was sworn in on Oct. 25.
He also opposes EU sanctions on Russia, and wants to block Ukraine from joining NATO.
event_breakdown: Slovakia's populist prime minister Robert Fico made his first public appearance on Friday since his serious wounding in an assassination attempt, praising his Hungarian counterpart despite sharp political differences. Fico supports Ukrainian opposition against Russia, which has opposed EU sanctions on Moscow for its actions in Ukraine.

title: Arrests after two men reportedly stabbed in city
message:
Police were called to reports of a fight on Thompson Road [Google]Two men have been arrested after reports of a stabbing during a fight in Sheffield.
Officers were called to reports of fighting outside a property on Thompson Road in the Broomhall area of the city shortly after 21:00 BST on Friday.
Two men were taken to hospital with injuries "consistent with a stabbing" but their injuries are not believed to be life-threatening, police said.
The men, aged 54 and 18, have been arrested on suspicion of grievous bodily harm.
Police are appealing for anyone who was in the area at the time with information, CCTV or dashcam footage to get in touch.
event_breakdown: Police have arrested two men who were involved in a reported stabbing on Thompson Road in Sheffield. The stabbing happened during a fight between the two men outside of a property. Officers were called to the scene shortly after 9 PM on Friday. The two men were taken to the hospital and their injuries are "consistent with a stabbing," but not life-threatening.

title: Last of Rochester Hills splash pad shooting victims out of the hospital
message:
Last of Rochester Hills splash pad shooting victims out of the hospitalGRAND RAPIDS, Mich. (WOOD) — Three weeks after a gunman opened fired at a splash pad in southeastern Michigan, the last of the nine people injured was released from the hospital Friday, authorities say.
The Oakland County Sheriff’s Office said in a release that the 39-year-old Rochester Hills woman was shot multiple times trying to protect her children.
“While we are incredibly pleased all shooting victims have been released from the hospital, we know there is a long road ahead on both the physical and psychological healing,” Sheriff Michael Bouchard said in a statement.
“Our support will remain with the victims, and we will continue to look for any information that gives insight into the motive of the shooter.”The shooting happened June 15 at a splash pad in the Detroit suburb of Rochester Hills.
Authorities have indicated the attack was random — the shooter didn’t have any link to those shot or the splash pad.
event_breakdown:
Location: Rochester Hills, Michigan
Reported: June 15, 2022
Summary: Three weeks after a gunman opened fired at a splash pad in southeastern Michigan, the last of the nine people injured was released from the hospital Friday, authorities say.

title: OKC police identify fatal stabbing victim ; suspect jailed on murder complaint
message:
Police on Friday publicly confirmed the identity of a victim from a fatal stabbing in northwest Oklahoma City a week ago.
The Oklahoma City Police Department announced the name of the victim, Allen Williams, 39, in a news release.
Williams was found dead by police after a report of a stabbing near the intersection of NW 23 and N MacArthur Boulevard around 5 p.m. on June 28.
According to investigators, Williams had been fighting with another man near the street when the other man stabbed Williams to death with a knife.
This article originally appeared on Oklahoman: Fatal stabbing victim identified by police 2 days after suspect jailed
event_breakdown:
Event 1: A fatal stabbing in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma on June 28 resulted in the victim, Allen Williams, 39, being killed. Police identified the killer as another man who was fighting with Williams when the stabbing occurred.
Event 2: Police in Oklahoma City publicly identified Allen Williams as the victim in the fatal stabbing that occurred on June 28.

title: Slovakia PM Makes First Public Appearance Since Assassination Attempt
message:
BRATISLAVA, Slovakia (AP) – Slovakia’s populist Prime Minister Robert Fico made his first public appearance on Friday since he was seriously wounded in an assassination attempt, attacking his liberal political opponents and praising his Hungarian counterpart.
Fico ended his country’s military aid for Ukraine after his coalition government was sworn in on Oct. 25.
He has long been a divisive figure in Slovakia and beyond.
His critics worry that Slovakia could abandon its pro-Western course and follow the direction of Hungary under Prime Minister Viktor OrbánThousands have repeatedly rallied in the capital and across Slovakia to protest Fico’s policies.
Slovak Gunman Attacked Because of Views on Ukraine War, According to Confession https://t.co/iNd9g0UO2q — Breitbart London (@BreitbartLondon) May 24, 2024

title: UN warns of escalation of tension on Lebanon - Israel border
message:
Xinhua | Updated: 2024-07-06 13:12A fire truck extinguishes a fire caused by a shelling attack near Israel's northern border, July 4, 2024.
[Photo/Xinhua]UNITED NATIONS - The United Nations expressed grave concerns on Friday about intensified clashes along the Lebanon-Israel frontier, known as the Blue Line.
The world body highlighted the mounting tensions following an increase in exchanges of fire between Lebanese and Israeli forces.
This recent surge in hostilities, which occurred on Thursday, "heightens the risk of a full-scale war," according to a note from the office of the spokesperson for the UN secretary-general.
The note underscored the necessity of restraint, noting, "Escalation can and must be avoided.

event_breakdown:
1. Target event: Violent clash breaks out between police and protesters in Beirut
Violent clashes erupted between police and protesters in Beirut on Saturday, leaving several people injured. The clashes erupted when security forces tried to disperse the protesters who were demonstrating against the deteriorating political and economic situation in Lebanon. The protesters had gathered in Beirut's Martyrs' Square to demand the government's resignation and action to address the economic crisis in the country. The clashes lasted for more than an hour before riot police managed to control the situation.
2. Target event: Explosion at military warehouse in Siberia
An explosion occurred at a military warehouse in Siberia on Friday, injuring several people and causing significant property damage. The explosion occurred at the warehouse in the town of Achinsk, which is located in the Russian Republic of Bashkortostan, and is believed to have been caused by a technical malfunction in the equipment. Several local residents reported hearing a loud explosion and seeing a large cloud of smoke coming from the area, and the area was cordoned off by emergency services. The residents of the nearby buildings were temporarily evacuated due to safety concerns.
3. Target event: New clashes break out between protesters and security forces in Chile
New clashes broke out between protesters and security forces in Chile on Saturday, following weeks of protests and demonstrations over social and economic issues. The clashes broke out in downtown Santiago, the capital, when protesters tried to break through a cordon of security forces that had been set up to protect government buildings. Police used water cannons to disperse the protesters, and made several arrests. The clashes lasted for more than an hour before a ceasefire was called, although smaller groups of protesters continued to demonstrate throughout the day.

title: Muharram 2024 key dates for start of Islamic New Year and the Day of Ashura
message:
The Islamic calendar is now heading towards the end of the year 1445 and the start of 1446, with Muharram the first month.
The 10th day of Muharram is known as the Day of Ashura, which is observed by both Sunni and Shia Muslims.
Key dates in Muharram:1st Muharram: Islamic new year.
The Islamic calendar is based on the moon, and 12 lunar cycles amount to 354 days.
The difference between the two calendars is 10 or 11 days, meaning Islamic dates move forward by 10 or 11 days a year.
event_breakdown: The month of Muharram is now coming to an end and the Islamic calendar is about to enter the new year, 1447. Key dates in Muharram are the Islamic new year and the Day of Ashura.

title: Ukrainian troops pay last respects to Briton killed in clash with Russian forces
message:
Peter Fouche, 49, died “in the battlefield” on June 27 as his unit clashed with Russian troops, according to his colleague at Project Konstantin, the volunteer group that since 2022 has ferried drones, vehicles, uniforms and food to Ukrainian soldiers in the east.
Comrades of Peter Fouche at the funeral in Kyiv (Alex Babenko/AP)According to its website, it has also helped evacuate 219 Ukrainian soldiers from combat zones.
At the funeral ceremony, Ukrainian soldiers carried Mr Fouche’s coffin through Kyiv’s landmark Independence Square, the site of mass protests in 2014 that forced out a pro-Russian president.
Mr Fouche’s comrades held back tears as they lined up to say goodbye.
At least five other Britons have been killed while volunteering in Ukraine since Russia’s full-scale invasion in February 2022.

Peter Fouche, 49, died “in the battlefield” on June 27 as his unit clashed with Russian troops, according to his colleague at Project Konstantin, the volunteer group that since 2022 has ferried drones, vehicles, uniforms and food to Ukrainian soldiers in the east.
Comrades of Peter Fouche at the funeral in Kyiv (Alex Babenko/AP)According to its website, it has also helped evacuate 219 Ukrainian soldiers from combat zones.
At the funeral ceremony, Ukrainian soldiers carried Mr Fouche’s coffin through Kyiv’s landmark Independence Square, the site of mass protests in 2014 that forced out a pro-Russian president.
Mr Fouche’s comrades held back tears as they lined up to say goodbye.
At least five other Britons have been killed while volunteering in Ukraine since Russia’s full-scale invasion in February 2022.
event_breakdown: Russian troops clash with Ukrainian forces in the east of the country, killing a British volunteer, Peter Fouche, in the Donbas region.

title: Ukrainian troops pay last respects to Briton killed in clash with Russian forces
message:
Ukrainian service members have gathered in Kyiv to pay last respects to a British combat medic who set up a charity delivering essential supplies to frontline fighters.
Peter Fouche, 49, died “in the battlefield” on June 27 as his unit clashed with Russian troops, according to his colleague at Project Konstantin, the volunteer group that since 2022 has ferried drones, vehicles, uniforms and food to Ukrainian soldiers in the east.
Others read prayers as they held up Ukrainian flags and military insignia.
His partner, wearing a traditional Ukrainian embroidered shirt, knelt down to embrace the coffin.
At least five other Britons have been killed while volunteering in Ukraine since Russia’s full-scale invasion in February 2022.

message:

title: Russian strikes leave thousands in northern Ukraine without power and water
message:
Russian strikes have left over 100,000 households without power in northern Ukraine and cut off the water supply to the regional capital of SumyKYIV, Ukraine -- Russian strikes overnight left over 100,000 households without power in northern Ukraine and cut off the water supply to a regional capital, Ukrainian authorities reported Saturday, while civilian casualties rose sharply in the country's embattled east.
The northern Sumy region, which borders Russia, was plunged into darkness after Russian strikes late Friday damaged energy infrastructure, the Ukrainian Energy Ministry said.
In the Donetsk region in the east, Russian shelling on Friday and overnight killed 11 civilians and wounded 43, local Gov.
The Ukrainian General Staff on Saturday morning said that Ukrainian and Russian forces clashed 45 times near Pokrovsk over the previous day.
In Russia, two civilians were wounded after Ukrainian forces overnight shelled a border town in the southern Belgorod region, its Gov.

KYIV, UKRAINE -- Russian strikes in northern Ukraine have left 100,000 households without power and cut off the water supply to the city of Sumy.

DONETSK -- Russian shelling in the eastern Donetsk region killed 11 civilians and wounded 43 overnight.

POKROVSK -- Ukrainian and Russian forces clashed 45 times near Pokrovsk overnight.

BELOGOROD, RUSSIA -- Two civilians were wounded after Ukrainian forces shelled a border town in the Russian Belgorod region overnight.

title: Footage reveals : The weapons IDF forces found in the heart of Shejaiya
message:
In the last week, the 7th Brigade Combat Team has been operating under the command of the 98th Division.
The soldiers are engaging in combat against terrorists, both above and below ground, and are eliminating them using tank fire and directing aerial fire.
During the operations in the Shejaiya area, the soldiers located underground tunnel shafts and confiscated weapons and long-range rockets indicating a renewed attempt by the enemy to establish a base in the area.
In addition, the soldiers destroyed booby-trapped explosives that the enemy had buried in the area.
This week, during the fighting in the area, Captain Roy Miller z”l, of the Rotem Battalion, and Captain Elay Elisha Lugasi z”l, of the 75th Battalion, fell in combat.

title: The Immigration War No One Talks About
message:
The Dutch Boers (lit: farmers, also called Afrikaners) in South Africa fled inland, away from the Cape Colony, after the British took it over in 1814.
In 1881, the Boers won the First Boer War, which secured their independence, though the British claimed they were still a vassal state.
When the Boer War started, almost no one on the planet rooted for the British.
The Boer War had been fought for the control of gold by the elite, not for the common man.
The Boer War is a cornerstone to history, and no one teaches it rightly.
event_breakdown:
Boer War
Gold
Cape Colony

title: Canada names first woman to lead its military
message:
Lieutenant-General Jennie Carignan, tasked with addressing ingrained sexism and misconduct in the armed forces, will assume the role of Chief of the Defense Staff on July 18.
Carignan, originally a military engineer, has commanded troops in Afghanistan, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Iraq, and Syria during her 35-year military career.
The armed forces are currently struggling to meet recruitment goals and have been slow to replace outdated equipment.
Additionally, the last two governors-general, the official representatives of the British monarchy, have been women appointed by Trudeau.
She joined the military in 1986, three years before Canada allowed women in combat roles.
event_breakdown:
The Canadian government has appointed Lieutenant-General Jennie Carignan as the new Chief of the Defense Staff, making her the first woman to hold the position. She will assume the role on July 18, and will be responsible for overseeing Canada's armed forces and addressing ongoing issues of sexism and misconduct. Carignan was originally a military engineer and has served as commander of troops in Afghanistan, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Iraq, and Syria during her 35-year military career.

Additionally, the Canadian government has appointed two more female governors-general, the official representatives of the British monarchy in Canada. Julie Payette, a lawyer and astronaut, and Paulette Lenard, a lawyer and law professor at the University of Western Ontario, were appointed by current Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.

title: Customs , NNPCL collaborate to tackle fuel smuggling in Nigeria
message:
The Nigeria Customs Service and the Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited have partnered to tackle fuel smuggling in the country.
The Comptroller-General of Customs, Adewale disclosed this in a statement after the Group Chief Executive Officer of NNPCL, Mele Kyari led the company’s delegate to the headquarters of NSC on Friday.
Adeniyi stressed his commitment to reinvigorate the existing partnership between NSC and NNPCL to effectively combat the smuggling of petroleum products outside Nigeria.
On his part, Kyari stated that the smuggling of PMS is a major National challenge for the country.
He requested the CGC’s help to minimize the smuggling of PMS outside Nigeria.
event_breakdown:
1. The Nigeria Customs Service and the Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited have partnered to tackle fuel smuggling in the country.
2. The Comptroller-General of Customs Adeniyi committed the revitalisation of an existing partnership between NSC and NNPCL to effectively combat the smuggling of petroleum products outside Nigeria.

title: Hezbollah launches over 200 rockets at Israel | Northwest Arkansas Democrat - Gazette
message:
BEIRUT -- The Lebanese Hezbollah group said it launched over 200 rockets on Thursday at several military bases in Israel in retaliation for a strike that killed one of its senior commanders.
After Hezbollah's attack, Israel struck various towns in southern Lebanon.
Hours after the killing, Hezbollah launched scores of Katyusha rockets and Falaq rockets with heavy warheads into northern Israel and Golan Heights.
Hezbollah says it is striking Israel in solidarity with Hamas, another Iran-allied group that ignited the war in Gaza with its Oct. 7 attack into southern Israel.
Israel sees Hezbollah as its most direct threat and estimates that it has an arsenal of 150,000 rockets and missiles, including precision-guided missiles.
event_breakdown:
Location: Israel, Lebanon
Hezbollah fires rockets at northern Israel and Golan Heights in retaliation for a strike that killed a senior commander. Israel strikes several towns in southern Lebanon.

title: Israeli strike kills 16 at Gaza school , military says it targeted gunmen
message:
CAIRO/GAZA - At least 16 people were killed in an Israeli strike on a school sheltering displaced Palestinian families in central Gaza on Saturday (July 6), the Palestinian health ministry said, in an attack Israel said had targeted militants.
The health ministry said the attack on the school in Al-Nuseirat killed at least 16 people and wounded more than 50.
The health ministry does not distinguish between combatants and non-combatants but officials say most the dead are civilians.
The Israeli military said forces continued "intelligence-base operations" in Rafah, destroyed several underground structures, seized weapons and equipment, and killed several Palestinian gunmen.
The Israeli military said it eliminated a Hamas rocket cell in Deir Al-Balah in central Gaza that operated from inside a humanitarian-designated area.

title: Hizbollah Says Israeli Strike Kills Senior Commander
message:
"A Hizbollah commander responsible for one of three sectors in south Lebanon was killed" in an "Israeli strike on a car in Tyre", a source told AFP, requesting anonymity as they were not authorised to speak to the media.
Another source close to the group, also requesting anonymity, confirmed Nasser was killed in the strike in Tyre, and said he was the third senior Hizbollah commander to be killed in almost nine months of hostilities.
The first source said Nasser had the same rank as Taleb Abdallah, a commander killed in an Israeli strike last month who was described by a Lebanese military source at the time as the“most important” Hizbollah commander killed to date.
That strike prompted Hizbollah to intensify its attacks on Israeli targets, firing barrages of rockets across the border in the days that followed.

title: Hamas clears way for possible ceasefire in Gaza after dropping key demand
message:
DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza (AP) — Hamas has given its initial approval of a U.S.-backed proposal for a phased cease-fire deal in Gaza, dropping a key demand that Israel commit up front to a complete end to the war, a Hamas official and an Egyptian official said Saturday.
Hamas still wants written guarantees from mediators that Israel will continue to negotiate a permanent cease-fire deal once the first phase goes into effect, the officials said.
Months of on-again off-again cease-fire talks have stumbled over Hamas’ demand that any deal include a complete end to the war.
Israeli officials have said they are worried Hamas will draw out the talks and the initial cease-fire indefinitely without releasing all the hostages.
Israel launched the war in Gaza after Hamas’ October attack in which militants stormed into southern Israel, killed some 1,200 people — mostly civilians — and abducted about 250.

title: Here Why the Swedish CV - 90 Is Touted as the Best Fighting Vehicle Ever
message:
Here's Why The Swedish CV-90 Is Touted As The Best Fighting Vehicle EverSince Russia invaded Ukraine in 2022, various nations have supplied the beleaguered nation with all manner of arms and armaments.
One vehicle that hasn't received as much attention is arguably one of the most important in the conflict: The Swedish-made Combat Vehicle 90, or CV-90, armored infantry fighting vehicle (IFV).
Each new Mk design integrated modern advancements, ensuring the CV-90 remained a relevant vehicle on the battlefield.
It's unclear how many CV-90s Ukraine produced domestically, but it's clear the nation received only around 50 CV-90s as of March 2024.
Despite the small number of vehicles inside Ukraine, the CV-90 has proven its worth as one of the most effective fighting vehicles used in the conflict to date.
event_breakdown: Swedish-made CV-90 armored infantry fighting vehicles have proven themselves in Ukraine by fending off the Russians.

title: Up to 728 , 000 Russian Soldiers Killed or Wounded in Ukraine War
message:
The Economist estimates that between 462,000 and 728,000 Russian soldiers have been killed or wounded in the war against Ukraine.
These figures do not include Ukrainians recruited by Russia from occupied territories or seriously injured Russian soldiers who cannot return to battle.
The Economist calculates that for every Russian soldier killed in battle, there are about three to four wounded.
By mid-June, The Economist estimated that between 462,000 and 728,000 Russian soldiers had been killed or wounded, exceeding the number of Russian invasion forces in February 2022.
In addition, analysts at the American Institute for the Study of War estimated in June that Russian losses could amount to up to 20,000 killed and wounded monthly.

title: Indonesia takes defence cooperation with Turkiye to next level
message:
Indonesia takes defence cooperation with Turkiye to next levelJakarta (ANTARA) - Indonesia and Turkiye continue to take bilateral cooperation in the defense sector to the next level as marked by Deputy Defence Minister Muhammad Herindra's visit to Turkiye last week.As his main agenda, on Thursday (July 4) Herindra met with the Turkish Defense Vice Minister, Bilal Durdali, and CEOs of several Turkish defense companies, according to the Indonesian Embassy in Ankara.Herindra regarded Turkiye as an "important friend that has for a long time maintained defense cooperation with Indonesia", the Indonesian Embassy disclosed in a press statement published on Saturday.He said that the two countries have opportunities to expand their defense cooperation, especially in building mutual trust, increasing military capacity, and developing the defense manufacturing sector in the future.His visit became part of Indonesia's endeavors to strengthen its strategic partnership with Turkiye in defense and its industrial cooperation, Herindra added.At their meeting, the embassy revealed, Herindra and Durlali confirmed the Indonesian and Turkish defense ministers' commitment to continuing the two countries' solid cooperation in building a strategic partnership and contributing to world peace and stability.Meanwhile, Indonesian Ambassador to Turkiye Achmad Rizal Purnama, who accompanied Herindra during the visit, said Turkiye is the right partner for Indonesia in developing defense industry.Turkiye is recorded as one of the few countries that is willing to partner with Indonesia in developing the defense industrial sector by implementing the transfer of technology mechanism, he added.At multilateral fora and for addressing current crucial issues, Turkiye is also Indonesia's most trusted partner, he said, adding that Indonesia's defense cooperation with Turkiye aims to meet long-term needs.Therefore, Ambassador Purnama opined that the defense cooperation between Indonesia and Turkiye could be stated in a strategic document of a long-term strategic partnership on defense industries grand design.By doing so, the document would function as "deliverables" at Indonesian and Turkish leaders' meeting in the future, he said.During his visit to Turkiye, Herindra also met the representatives of FNSS, Turkish armed combat vehicle manufacturer, and Turkish Aerospace (TUSAS).FNSS, as revealed on its official website, "specializes in designing and producing wheeled and tracked armored combat vehicles as well as combat engineering vehicles, turrets, and sustainability solutions".FNSS has cooperated with Indonesia's state-owned weapons manufacturer PT Pindad in producing the medium tank, "Harimau".TUSAS, which claims to be one of the global players in the aviation and space industry, has six strategic business centers, including national combat aircraft (NCA) group, aircraft group, and helicopter group.

title: Released Gaza Detainees Allege Torture By Israel Amid War
message:
(MENAFN- Gulf Times) Blindfolded, beaten and sometimes bitten by dogs, Gazans released from Israeli prisons allege being tortured amid the Israel-Hamas war, which rights groups say has worsened conditions for detainees.
While the UN and others have long raised concerns about conditions for Palestinian detainees in Israeli prisons, rights groups say legal changes since the Gaza war erupted have aggravated the situation.
AFP interviewed some of the 50 prisoners taken to Kamal Adwan Hospital in the Gaza Strip after their release by Israel on June 11.
It said the military adheres to Israeli and international law, emphasising that detainees released to Gaza“are under the control of a fighter organisation that can force them to provide false information”.
Hundreds are awaiting indictment, the attorney added, while more than 1,500 have been released and returned to Gaza.

Gaza

A former Indian Army general who deployed in the region surrounding Pangong Lake, speaking on the condition of anonymity, said China’s expanded development of subterranean infrastructure made perfect military sense.
This border infrastructure drive has been fueled by greater investment and the rapid implementation of important projects to assist military operations.

title: US - British Coalition Launches Airstrike On Yemen Kamaran Island
message:
SANAA — The US-British naval coalition launched an airstrike on Kamaran Island, the largest Yemeni island in the Red Sea, the Houthi-run al-Masirah TV reported.
The US-British coalition has not yet commented on the alleged strike.
Kamaran Island is located off the Yemeni port city of Hodeidah.
In response, the US-British naval coalition stationed in the waters has since January conducted air raids and missile strikes against Houthi targets to deter the group.
However, the coalition’s intervention only led to an expansion of Houthi attacks to include US and British commercial vessels and naval ships.

title: Deadly Gaza battles , Hezbollah rockets as war enters 10th month
message:
July 7, 2024 — Gaza Strip (Palestinian Territories) (AFP)Israel carried out deadly air strikes in the Gaza Strip on Sunday as the war entered its 10th month, with fighting raging across the Palestinian territory and fresh diplomatic efforts underway to halt the violence.
Lebanon's Hezbollah movement fired another 20 rockets at northern Israel, leaving one person injured there, the latest cross-border attacks launched in solidarity with Gaza's Palestinian militant group Hamas.
Efforts towards a truce continued with US, Qatari and Egyptian mediators hoping to halt the worst-ever Gaza war, which has caused mass civilian casualties and devastated the coastal territory since Hamas's October 7 attack on Israel.
The militants also seized 251 hostages, 116 of whom remain in Gaza, including 42 the military says are dead.

title: New European EuroPULS Rocket Launcher Could Rival HIMARS
message:
Europe is building a multiple rocket launcher that resembles America's HIMARS, the ground-fired weapon that took on the precision strike missions that Ukraine's battered air force couldn't.
Many, such as France's LRU and Germany's MARS 2, are based on the U.S. M270, a tracked mobile rocket launcher, and its Guided Multiple Launch Rocket System rockets.
One HIMARS launcher can carry six GMLRS rockets or one longer-range ATACMS ballistic missile.
HIMARS rockets destroyed Russian ammunition depots and headquarters, disrupting logistics and command and control, and spurring Russian forces to move vital facilities deeper behind their lines.
Collectively, such trends are prompting some militaries to consider possible alternatives to the US HIMARS system, though certainly that remains a major player in this competition for contracts."

title: Five journalists killed as Israel steps up bombardment across Gaza | Times of Suriname – grootste landelijk dagblad van Suriname
message:
GAZA – At least five journalists were killed in attacks by Israeli forces in the last 24 hours in Gaza as bombings and air strikes across the besieged enclave intensified.
Before the latest deadly attacks, Israel’s war on Gaza was already considered the deadliest conflict for journalists and media workers in the world.
The New York-based Committee to Protect Journalists, which has a separate database on Palestinian journalists killed in Gaza, put the number of media workers killed as of July 5 at 108 since the war began, also making it the deadliest period since the group began gathering data in 1992.
An earlier Israeli attack had wounded Wael and killed his cameraperson Samer Abudaqa during a reporting assignment in southern Gaza in December.

title: Hamas clears the way for a possible cease - fire in Gaza after dropping key demand , officials say
message:
Hamas clears the way for a possible cease-fire in Gaza after dropping key demand, officials sayDEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza (AP) — Hamas has given its initial approval of a U.S.-backed proposal for a phased cease-fire deal in Gaza, dropping a key demand that Israel commit up front to a complete end to the war, a Hamas official and an Egyptian official said Saturday.
Hamas still wants written guarantees from mediators that Israel will continue to negotiate a permanent cease-fire deal once the first phase goes into effect, the two officials said.
Months of on-again off-again cease-fire talks have stumbled over Hamas’ demand that any deal include a complete end to the war.
Israeli officials have said they are worried Hamas will draw out the talks and the initial cease-fire indefinitely without releasing all the hostages.
Israel launched the war in Gaza after Hamas’ October attack in which militants stormed into southern Israel, killed some 1,200 people — mostly civilians — and abducted about 250.

title: Pakistan defense minister vows  no cake and pastrie for TTP militants , after apparent China warning
message:
(You can now subscribe to our(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channelPakistan's defense minister, Khawaja Asif , has confirmed that the country will persist in launching military strikes against Afghanistan to counter terrorism .
Speaking to BBC, he emphasized that these operations are a necessary response to attacks on Pakistani security forces and civilians, stating, "We won’t serve them with cake and pastries."
Pakistan's government maintains that its military actions are justified and necessary to safeguard its national security.Tensions between Pakistan and Afghanistan have escalated since the Taliban took control of Afghanistan in 2021.
Pakistan alleges that despite its repeated requests, the Afghan Taliban has been reluctant to take action against the TTP, which has been using Afghan territory to launch attacks on Pakistan.
Pakistan's military attributed the attack to planners in Afghanistan, identifying the bomber as an Afghan national, a claim that Kabul denies.In response to the March attack, Pakistani authorities have arrested 11 militants from the TTP involved in the bombing.

title: Health ministry in Hamas - run Gaza says 16 killed in strike on UN school
message:
GAZA STRIP, Palestinian Territories, July 7, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - The Hamas government in Gaza said an Israeli strike on Saturday on a UN-run school where thousands of displaced were sheltering killed 16 people.
The Israeli military said its aircraft targeted "terrorists" operating around the Al-Jawni school in Nuseirat, central Gaza.
The health ministry in the Hamas-run territory, which condemned the strike as an "odious massacre", said 50 injured were taken to hospital from the school.
"Absolutely no place in the Gaza Strip is safe," said civil defence spokesman Mahmud Bassal.
In response, Israel has carried out a military offensive that has killed at least 38,098 people in Gaza, also mostly civilians, according to data from the Gaza health ministry.

title: Colombian ex - guerrillas traded war for whitewater rafting . Now dissident rebels are forcing them out
message:
Until recently, Caguán Expeditions had been one of the most inspiring stories to come out of Colombia’s 2016 peace deal.
More than 3,000 tourists from across the globe visited the ecotourism project to experience whitewater rafting and hiking excursions led by ex-combatants of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (Farc).
Their lack of experience outside of war – and deep stigmatization after six decades of war – have made it hard for ex-guerrillas to find work or start their own businesses.
Around 1,500 guerrillas are estimated to have never put down their weapons, and many more have likely returned to arms.
“All these efforts and dreams are now threatened by the return of conflict to our region.
event_breakdown: On August 10, Colombian police discovered a car bomb owned by dissidents of the FARC guerrilla group in Caquetá. This is one of the few instances of a car bomb being used in Colombia. Three people died and one was injured. The device, which weighed about 200 kilograms, had been moved to a remote area to prevent it from detonating in a crowded place. To move it, the dissidents took her to an area in Caquetá known for its coca crops. The Colombian government is trying to combat coca crops in the area, which has led to increased crime and confrontations between the criminal groups and FARC dissidents, who need to launder money for their operations. These crimes and confrontations put civilians at grave risk, and threaten to completely reverse the progress of Colombia's peace process, which has been hailed as a positive.

message:

Israel has barred international journalists from entering Gaza independently since the Hamas attack on Oct. 7 that sparked the war.

title: Ruthless Mughal emperors known for their lack of mercy
message: Sure, here are Mughal kings noted for their lack of mercy, each with a brief explanation:
event_breakdown:
1. Aurangazeb, sixth Mughal king, notorious for his execution of his brother and nephew.
2. Shah Jahan, known for the Taj Mahal and his reverence for his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
3. Aurangzeb, the "Alamgir," known for his military campaigns and strict religious policies.
4. Shah Jahan, known for his patronage of art and architecture.
5. Aurangzeb, also known as "Zafar," known for his piety and charitable works.
